intro: Kuhnia suaveolens, commonly known as sweet-scented kuhnia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
